original: gang gis mthar lta rnams ni rab spangs na //

translated: Then the youthful Candraprabha, having heard such a superior Dharma, became overjoyed. With palms joined, he addressed the Blessed One, saying:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One!

analyzed: sang gi gdugs la bdag de bzhin gshegs pa 'khor mang po dang bcas par gdugs tshod la spyan 'dren na /
translated: Tomorrow, I invite the Thus-Gone One, together with his retinue, for a meal.

original: thugs brtse bar dgongs te bdag gis sbyar ba'i gdugs tshod gsol bar ci gnang /
analyzed: thugs brtse bar dgongs te bdag gis sbyar ba'i gdugs tshod gsol bar ci gnang /
translated: Please consider this with compassion and allow me to prepare a meal for you.

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis zla 'od gzhon nur gyur pa de'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa dang / sems can tshad med pa rnams la yang phan gdags par 'gyur bar thugs kyis mkhyen nas thugs brtse bar dgongs te cang mi gsung bas gnang ngo //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis zla 'od gzhon nur gyur pa de'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa dang / sems can tshad med pa rnams la yang phan gdags par 'gyur bar thugs kyis mkhyen nas thugs brtse bar dgongs te cang mi gsung bas gnang ngo //
translated: The Buddha, knowing the purity of Candraprabhakumāra’s thoughts and that it would benefit countless beings, accepted his request with silence.

original: de nas zla 'od gzhon nur gyur pa bstan las langs nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag byas te lan gsum bskor ba byas nas rab tu dga' bas rang gi khyim du song ste /

translated: Candraprabhakumāra then rose from his seat, bowed his head to the Buddha’s feet, circumambulated him three times, and joyfully returned to his home.

original: rang gi 'khor dang bcas pa dang / lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / srin po dang / lto 'phye la sogs pas rgyal po'i khab grong khyer chen po'i bzhi mdor dar gyi lding khang bres te /
analyzed: rang gi 'khor dang bcas pa dang / lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / srin po dang / lto 'phye la sogs pas rgyal po'i khab grong khyer chen po'i bzhi mdor dar gyi lding khang bres te /
translated: Together with his retinue, as well as gods, nāgas, yakṣas, rākṣasas, mahoragas, and others, he erected a pavilion of silk in the center of the great city of Rājagṛha.

original: lding khang de yang shin tu mtho zhing rgya che la thams cad kun du khyab pa /
analyzed: lding khang de yang shin tu mtho zhing rgya che la thams cad kun du khyab pa /
translated: The pavilion was very high and vast, and it pervaded everywhere.

original: gser gyi tsong tsong dra bar bres pa /
analyzed: gser gyi tsong tsong dra bar bres pa /
translated: It was draped with golden tassels and nets.

analyzed: nor bu rin po che'i phreng ba dpyangs pa / sengge'i ba dan dang / gser gyi phreng ba lu gu rgyud can @372a *//
translated: It was hung with strings of precious jewels.🔽It was adorned with hundreds of thousands of various kinds of lion banners and golden chains.

original: 'bum phrag brgya stong sna tshogs kyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: 'bum phrag brgya stong sna tshogs kyis brgyan pa /
translated: It was adorned with hundreds of thousands of various kinds of lion banners and golden chains.

original: gzhan yang rin po che'i me tog kha dog khyad par du 'phags pa'i phreng ba'i phung po dag gcal du bkram mo //
analyzed: gzhan yang rin po che'i me tog kha dog khyad par du 'phags pa'i phreng ba'i phung po dag gcal du bkram mo //
translated: Moreover, heaps of garlands of precious flowers of extraordinary colors were spread out on the ground.

original: me tog tsampa ka dang / aa ti mukta la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyi phreng ba tshad med grangs med pa yang rin po che'i lding khang gi nang thams cad dang 'khor 'dus pa thams cad kun du khyab par dpyangs shing rgyan du bres so //
analyzed: me tog tsampa ka dang / aa ti mukta la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyi phreng ba tshad med grangs med pa yang rin po che'i lding khang gi nang thams cad dang 'khor 'dus pa thams cad kun du khyab par dpyangs shing rgyan du bres so //
translated: Garlands of various kinds of flowers such as campaka and atimukta were hung and arranged as ornaments, pervading the entire precious pavilion and all the assembled retinue, beyond measure and number.

original: gzhan yang de'i nang du khri stan rnams bshams nas rin po che'i spos phyi li ka dang / du ma tsa dang / tsandan dang / gur gum rnam par dag cing yid dga' bar byed pa sna tshogs bsregs so //
analyzed: gzhan yang de'i nang du khri stan rnams bshams nas rin po che'i spos phyi li ka dang / du ma tsa dang / tsandan dang / gur gum rnam par dag cing yid dga' bar byed pa sna tshogs bsregs so //
translated: Furthermore, they set up thrones and burned various kinds of precious incense—liquids, powders, sandalwood, and saffron—all of which were pure and delightful.

original: de bzhin du sbyar spos mchog dam pa sna tshogs kyang mchod pa'i yo byad du sbyar to //
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar spos mchog dam pa sna tshogs kyang mchod pa'i yo byad du sbyar to //
translated: They also prepared various kinds of excellent incense as offerings.

original: gzhan yang spos kyi chus lam srang rnams kun du khyab par chag chag btab bo //
analyzed: gzhan yang spos kyi chus lam srang rnams kun du khyab par chag chag btab bo //
translated: They also sprinkled the streets with perfumed water.

original: sa gzhi kun du me tog sna tshogs gcal du bkram mo; ;de'i tshe lha'i bu mo dang / lha ma yin gyi bu mo dang / sgra gcan 'dzin gyi bu mo grangs med tshad med pa yang rab tu dga' ba'i sems bskyed nas byang chub kyi rgyu mngon par sgrub par 'dod pa'i phyir der 'ongs nas grong khyer chen po de'i khyad par du 'phags pa de rab tu brgyan to //
analyzed: sa gzhi kun du me tog sna tshogs gcal du bkram mo; ;de'i tshe lha'i bu mo dang / lha ma yin gyi bu mo dang / sgra gcan 'dzin gyi bu mo grangs med tshad med pa yang rab tu dga' ba'i sems bskyed nas byang chub kyi rgyu mngon par sgrub par 'dod pa'i phyir der 'ongs nas grong khyer chen po de'i khyad par du 'phags pa de rab tu brgyan to //
translated: They scattered various kinds of flowers all over the ground. At that time, countless celestial maidens, asura maidens, and Rāhula’s daughters, with joyful minds, came to adorn the city in order to cultivate the causes of enlightenment.

original: de nas zla 'od gzhon nur gyur pas grong @372b khyer de kun du khyab par brgyan zhing yongs su dag pa dang / gdugs tshod la bab par rig nas bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas zla 'od gzhon nur gyur pas grong @372b khyer de kun du khyab par brgyan zhing yongs su dag pa dang / gdugs tshod la bab par rig nas bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the youth Candraprabha, having adorned and purified the entire city, and knowing that it was time for the meal, said this to the Bhagavān:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Bhagavān,

original: sems can rnams la sman par mdzad pa'i slad du grong khyer chen por gshegs su gsol //
analyzed: sems can rnams la sman par mdzad pa'i slad du grong khyer chen por gshegs su gsol //
translated: please enter the great city in order to benefit sentient beings.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das 'khor mang po dang thabs cig tu grong khyer du gshegs nas sgo'i them pa la zhabs bzhag ma thag tu grong khyer chen po de'i sa chen po yang rab tu g-yos par 'gyur //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das 'khor mang po dang thabs cig tu grong khyer du gshegs nas sgo'i them pa la zhabs bzhag ma thag tu grong khyer chen po de'i sa chen po yang rab tu g-yos par 'gyur //
translated: Then the Bhagavān, together with the great assembly, entered the city. As soon as he placed his foot on the threshold of the gate, the great earth of that great city shook.

original: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'bum phrag brgya stong tshad med pa yang rab tu g-yos par gyur te /
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'bum phrag brgya stong tshad med pa yang rab tu g-yos par gyur te /
translated: The immeasurable hundreds of thousands of myriads of millions of worlds in the ten directions also shook.

original: de'i tshe long ba dag gis mig gis gzugs mthong bar gyur /
analyzed: de'i tshe long ba dag gis mig gis gzugs mthong bar gyur /
translated: At that time, the blind saw forms with their eyes.

original: sdug bsngal ba rnams ni /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba rnams ni /
translated: Those who were suffering

original: bde ba thob par gyur //
analyzed: bde ba thob par gyur //
translated: attained happiness.

original: 'on pa rnams ni /
analyzed: 'on pa rnams ni /
translated: The deaf

original: rna bas sgra thos par gyur; byad bzhin mi sdug pa rnams ni /🔽byad bzhin bzang po thob par gyur /🔽nor med pa rnams ni /
analyzed: rna bas sgra thos par gyur; byad bzhin mi sdug pa rnams ni / byad bzhin bzang po thob par gyur / nor med pa rnams ni /
translated: Those who were ugly became beautiful.

original: nor dang ldan par gyur /🔽bu med pa rnams ni /
analyzed: nor dang ldan par gyur / bu med pa rnams ni /
translated: Those who were poor became wealthy.

original: bu yod par gyur /
analyzed: bu yod par gyur /
translated: Those who were childless had children.

original: gos med pa rnams ni; gos thob par gyur /🔽rin po che med pa rnams ni /
analyzed: gos med pa rnams ni; gos thob par gyur / rin po che med pa rnams ni /
translated: Those who were naked obtained clothing.

original: rin po che thob par gyur /🔽nye bshes med pa rnams ni /
analyzed: rin po che thob par gyur / nye bshes med pa rnams ni /
translated: Those who were without jewels obtained jewels.

original: nye bshes dang ldan par gyur /🔽lus kyi rgyan thams cad kyis phongs pa rnams ni /
analyzed: nye bshes dang ldan par gyur / lus kyi rgyan thams cad kyis phongs pa rnams ni /
translated: Those who were without friends obtained friends.

original: lus kyi rgyan thams cad dang ldan par gyur to //
analyzed: lus kyi rgyan thams cad dang ldan par gyur to //
translated: Those who were without ornaments obtained ornaments.

original: gzhan yang ngang pa dang / khrung khrung dang / ne tso dang / rma bya dang / ka ri ka la sogs pa bya'i tshogs mang po rnams de @373a *//
analyzed: gzhan yang ngang pa dang / khrung khrung dang / ne tso dang / rma bya dang / ka ri ka la sogs pa bya'i tshogs mang po rnams de @373a *//
translated: Moreover, many flocks of birds such as geese, cranes, parrots, peacocks, and myna birds,

original: bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba dang rab tu dga' ba'i sems bskyed nas sgra snyan cing yid du 'ong ba mchog dam pa phyung ste /
analyzed: bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba dang rab tu dga' ba'i sems bskyed nas sgra snyan cing yid du 'ong ba mchog dam pa phyung ste /
translated: when they saw the Thus-Gone One, gave rise to a joyful mind and produced supreme, melodious, and delightful sounds.

original: gang gis sgra de thos pa yang yid shin tu bde bar gyur to //
analyzed: gang gis sgra de thos pa yang yid shin tu bde bar gyur to //
translated: Those who heard this sound were filled with great joy.

original: gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs kyis tsampa ka'i ljon shing tshad med pa snyed mngon par sprul pas sems can brgya stong mang po rnams me tog yongs su dag pa de dag dang / gzhan yang spos mchog dam pa thogs nas bcom ldan 'das la mngon par gtor te mchod pa byas so //
analyzed: gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs kyis tsampa ka'i ljon shing tshad med pa snyed mngon par sprul pas sems can brgya stong mang po rnams me tog yongs su dag pa de dag dang / gzhan yang spos mchog dam pa thogs nas bcom ldan 'das la mngon par gtor te mchod pa byas so //
translated: Moreover, through the power of his supernormal abilities, the Thus-Gone One emanated countless champaka trees, and many hundreds of thousands of beings, holding those pure flowers and other sublime fragrances, scattered them over the Blessed One and made offerings.

original: gzhan yang lha ma yin gyi bu mo dbang phyug thob pa brgya stong du ma mu tig dmar po dang / tsandan gyi phye ma thogs nas de bzhin gshegs pa la rab tu dga' bas mngon par gtor to; ;lha ma yin mang po dang / gzhan yang lha mang po rnams rin po che'i gdugs gser dang dngul gyis rab tu brgyan pa thogs nas bar snang la 'dug ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang lha ma yin gyi bu mo dbang phyug thob pa brgya stong du ma mu tig dmar po dang / tsandan gyi phye ma thogs nas de bzhin gshegs pa la rab tu dga' bas mngon par gtor to; ;lha ma yin mang po dang / gzhan yang lha mang po rnams rin po che'i gdugs gser dang dngul gyis rab tu brgyan pa thogs nas bar snang la 'dug ste /
translated: Moreover, many hundreds of thousands of powerful daughters of the asuras, holding red pearls and sandalwood powder, joyfully scattered them over the Thus-Gone One. Many asuras and other gods held jeweled parasols adorned with gold and silver and remained in the sky,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i steng du khebs par g-yogs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i steng du khebs par g-yogs so //
translated: They covered the Thus-Gone One above.

original: gzhan yang bcom ldan 'das kyi rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs kyis tsandan gyi ljon shing dang / gser gyi ljon shing dang / rin po che'i snod dang / gos la sogs pa'i ljon shing brgya stong tshad med dpag tu med pa rin po che rnams kyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: gzhan yang bcom ldan 'das kyi rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs kyis tsandan gyi ljon shing dang / gser gyi ljon shing dang / rin po che'i snod dang / gos la sogs pa'i ljon shing brgya stong tshad med dpag tu med pa rin po che rnams kyis brgyan pa /
translated: Moreover, through the power of the Blessed One's miracles, he manifested countless hundreds of thousands of sandalwood trees, golden trees, precious vessels, clothing, and other trees adorned with precious substances,

original: me tog dang lo ma phun sum tshogs shing rgyas pa /
analyzed: me tog dang lo ma phun sum tshogs shing rgyas pa /
translated: with perfect and abundant flowers and leaves,

original: sems can tshad med pa'i bsod nams @373b kyi rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu thun mong du mngon par grub pa /
analyzed: sems can tshad med pa'i bsod nams @373b kyi rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu thun mong du mngon par grub pa /
translated: the common fruits of the ripening of the merit of countless beings,

original: rlung gi ngad langs pa tsam gyis spos mchog dam pa'i dris sangs rgyas kyi zhing tshad med pa rnams kun du khyab gang bar mngon par sprul to //
analyzed: rlung gi ngad langs pa tsam gyis spos mchog dam pa'i dris sangs rgyas kyi zhing tshad med pa rnams kun du khyab gang bar mngon par sprul to //
translated: pervading and filling countless buddha-fields with the fragrance of the supreme incense merely by the rising of the breeze.

original: sems can brgya stong tshad med pa rnams kyis kyang dus gcig tu me tog thogs nas bcom ldan 'das la mngon par gtor to //
analyzed: sems can brgya stong tshad med pa rnams kyis kyang dus gcig tu me tog thogs nas bcom ldan 'das la mngon par gtor to //
translated: Countless hundreds of thousands of beings simultaneously took flowers and scattered them upon the Blessed One.

original: de bzhin du sems can dang / sems can ma yin pa tshad med pa rnams kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs kyis mngon par sprul pa sha stag go /
analyzed: de bzhin du sems can dang / sems can ma yin pa tshad med pa rnams kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs kyis mngon par sprul pa sha stag go /
translated: In the same way, all the countless sentient and non-sentient beings were emanations created by the miraculous power of the Thus-Gone One.

original: gang dag ci dang ci smon pa de dag kyang rdzu 'phrul gyi dbang gis de dag gi bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du re ba yongs su rdzogs par gyur to //
analyzed: gang dag ci dang ci smon pa de dag kyang rdzu 'phrul gyi dbang gis de dag gi bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du re ba yongs su rdzogs par gyur to //
translated: Whatever wishes they had, by the power of his miracles, they were fulfilled according to their thoughts.

original: bcom ldan 'das grong khyer du gshegs pa'i tshe 'khor 'dus pa thams cad nam mkha' las khyad par du 'phags pa'i sgras bsam gyis mi khyab par yang dag par ston pa'i sgra thos par gyur kyang de gang nas byung ba shes par yang ma gyur la /

translated: When the Blessed One entered the city, all those gathered in the retinue heard a voice from the sky that proclaimed the inconceivable in a way that surpassed all other voices. Yet they did not know where it came from.

original: tshigs su bcad pa brgya stong du mas kyang chos rnams yang dag par bstan par gyur to //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa brgya stong du mas kyang chos rnams yang dag par bstan par gyur to //
translated: And the Dharma was perfectly taught through hundreds of thousands of verses.

original: bsam gtan stobs kyis byang chub brnyes par gyur //

original: bcom ldan 'das ni grong khyer zhugs pa'i tshe //

analyzed: shes rab stobs kyis byang chub brnyes par gyur // rdzu 'phrul mngon shes yon tan gnas shes stobs //

original: thabs dang gzungs kyi stobs dang grags pa'i stobs //
analyzed: thabs dang gzungs kyi stobs dang grags pa'i stobs //

analyzed: las dang rten 'byung yan lag dad dang thos // gtong dang mthun pa'i stobs dang rab zhi stobs //

original: rab dul yang dag mtha' dang dben mkhas stobs //
analyzed: rab dul yang dag mtha' dang dben mkhas stobs //

analyzed: 'jigs dang dga' dang phan 'dogs la mos dang // byams dang snying rje dga' snyoms bzod 'tshe med //

original: bcom ldan grong khyer gshegs nas zhabs bzhag tshe //

original: ngo mtshar mi 'dzin mi dga' gang yang med //

analyzed: gzhan yang rgyu rkyen bcu gnyis kyi //

analyzed: 'dus byas dang ni 'dus ma byas //

original: yang dag ji bzhin shes pa yin //
analyzed: yang dag ji bzhin shes pa yin //

analyzed: gzhan yang mig zad skye mtha' dang // mig gi mtha' dang rab dben dang // 'jug pa dang ni med pa dang // mi skye ba dang nyer zhi nyid //

analyzed: yang dag ji bzhin shes pas na //
translated: Is the correct and precise knowledge.

analyzed: sems can dag ni mang po rnams //
